result.execSummary:
The defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONSECUTIVE to Counts 2 and 3 AND CONSECUTIVE to 22CF1846. The Court granted Huber privileges for work.  Court allows for good time credit.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay mandatory all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aleczander M Watson-Wright

records.addlTxt:
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Counts 2 and 3 AND CONSECUTIVE to 22CF1846. The Court granted Huber privileges for work.  Court allows for good time credit. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1 and 3 AND CONSECUTIVE to 22CF1846. The Court granted Huber privileges for work.  Court allows for good time credit. 

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1 and 2 AND CONSECUTIVE to 22CF1846. The Court granted Huber privileges for work.  Court allows for good time credit. 

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3:
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AS TO COUNT 1: 90 DAYS condition time, consecutive to Counts 2 and 3, STAYED and to be used at the department's discretion.  Court grants Huber release for work.  Court allows good time credit.
- AS TO COUNT 2: 90 DAYS condition time, consecutive to Counts 1 and 3, STAYED and to be used at the department's discretion.  Court grants Huber release for work.  Court allows good time credit.
- AS TO COUNT 3: 90 DAYS condition time, consecutive to Counts 1 and 2, STAYED and to be used at the department's discretion.  Court grants Huber release for work.  Court allows good time credit.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Provide DNA sample.
- No use or possession of alcohol. 
- No use or possession of any prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- Actively participate in cognitive behavior therapy.
- Complete a psychological or psychiatric evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment. 
- NO CONTACT with McDonald's located at 6631 West North Avenue, Wauwatosa, Wisconsin.
- NO CONTACT with O'Reilly Auto Parts located at at 6102 West North Avenue, Wauwatosa, Wisconsin.
- NO CONTACT with Dairy Queen located at 6520 West North Avenue, Wauwatosa Wisconsin.
- NO CONTACT with Mayfair Mall.
- NO CONTACT with District 3 Police Department and Officers UNLESS in a professional manner (i.e. defendant reaching out for help).


Court ordered the defendant to pay mandatory all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  20 day appeal rights given.

Court scheduled a restitution hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Aleczander M Watson-Wright.  Attorney Dax Odom in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, appeared in person. Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared  by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. 
Discussion held. Defendant has pending felony matters in Branch 2. Defense counsel will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorized transfer to Branch 2 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted. If not resolved, place back on Branch 37 calendar.
Court ordered matter adjourned to Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Any McDonald's, Dairy Queen, Subway, or O'Reilly Auto Parts in Milwaukee County.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 37.

Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties reviewed doctor report and do not contest findings. State, defense and defendant waive right to hearing. Court adopts Dr. Niess' report. Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail. Case remains calendared in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Return on Doctor's Report rescheduled to 6/16/2022 at 8:30 am.
from Dr. Niess, received and filed.
for reasons stated in the declined order
records.descr: Order Submitted in PDF Format Declined

records.addlTxt: Proposed no contact/no firearms order forwarded to court for review.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant refused to come out to court.
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/18/2022@1:30pm
